title: ** READ ME **
text: Permissions for everything in this Internal Support KB must be set to Agent only. Permissions are inherited from the folder that other folders and articles are in, so to avoid a mistake if someone adds a folder and forgets to set the Agent only permission (which might mean it being published on the customer portal for everyone to see!), it's best for everything to be under this folder and inherit its permissions
description: Permissions for everything in this Internal Support KB must be set to Agent only. Permissions are inherited from the folder that other folders and articles are in, so to avoid a mistake if someone adds a folder and forgets to set the Agent only permission (which might mean it being published on the customer portal for everyone to see!), it's best for everything to be under this folder and inherit its permissions

title: RollingFileAppender settings
text: For setting the LOG options of a service you can find all informtion on : https://logging.apache.org/log4net/ For eample settings for a Webservice PublicGateway In the configSections part add the section for the settings. . . in this part the settings foor the log files Result would look like this
description:
For setting the LOG options of a service you can find all informtion on :  https://logging.apache.org/log4net/


For eample settings for a Webservice PublicGateway


In the configSections part add the section for the settings.


<configSections>

.

<section name="log4net" type="DRS.PublicGateway.Log, DRS.DocumentGateway"/>

.

  </configSections>


in this part the settings foor the log files


  <log4net>

    <appender name="RollingFileAppender" type="log4net.Appender.RollingFileAppender">

    <!-- define the location and name -->

      <file value="Log\DRS.PublicGateway.log"/>

      <appendToFile value="true"/>

      <lockingModel type="log4net.Appender.FileAppender+MinimalLock"/>

      <layout type="log4net.Layout.PatternLayout">

        <conversionPattern value="%date [%3thread] [%6property{instance}] %-5level %logger - %message%newline"/>

      </layout>

    <!--  Define the type of RollingFile , most used is Size-->

      <rollingStyle value="Size"/> 

    <!-- Maximum Files to Save -->

      <maxSizeRollBackups value="10"/>

    <!-- Maximum size fo one file, when reached this size a new file is created with next number -->

      <maximumFileSize value="100MB"/>

      <staticLogFileName value="true"/>

    </appender>

    <appender name="OutputDebugStringAppender" type="log4net.Appender.OutputDebugStringAppender">

      <layout type="log4net.Layout.PatternLayout">

        <conversionPattern value="%date [%3thread] [%6property{instance}] %-5level %logger - %message [Process Info: ID=%property{PROCINFO_ID} NonPaged=%property{PROCINFO_NonpagedMem} Paged=%property{PROCINFO_PagedMem} Private=%property{PROCINFO_PrivateMem} Virtual=%property{PROCINFO_VirtualMem} WorkingSet=%property{PROCINFO_WorkingSet}]%newline"/>

      </layout>

    </appender>

    <root>

    <!--  Define the logging level, INFO, ERROR, WARNING or DEBUG  (Only for debugging !)-->

      <level value="Info"/>

      <appender-ref ref="RollingFileAppender"/>

      <appender-ref ref="OutputDebugStringAppender"/>

    </root>

  </log4net>



Result would look like this

    <!--  Define the type of RollingFile , most used is Size-->

title: Disk Full drive C because of WinXsX files for Windows Updates
text: INHOUDSOPGAVE C drive Full - General Clean Up WINsXs folder See also info found on Chat GPT WinSxS" folder StartComponentCleanup C drive Full - General It can happen in case of a small C-Drive on your server that this drive is running out of disk space because there are Windows update downloaded and pending for a server reboot to be installed. The cause of this is mostly the contents of the folder Windows\WinSxS In the folder Windows\WinSxS the files for the updates are stored. After the installation of the Updates is finished you will see that Windows has cleaned up a big part of this folder. Clean Up WINsXs folder It is recommended to start the task StartComponentCleanUp after the reboot and Updates You can find this task in Windows Scheduled tasks: R-mouse click and choose run. Attention: This can take a long time ! You can not start this task when there are till Updates pending for installation which require a reboot See also info found on Chat GPT WinSxS" folder The "WinSxS" folder, which stands for "Windows Side by Side," is a critical component of the Windows operating system architecture, particularly in versions such as Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 10. The folder contains what are called "side-by-side" assemblies. Here are a few reasons why the WinSxS folder can become large: 1. Component Store: WinSxS is essentially a component store that holds various versions of system files and system file dependencies. This redundancy is necessary to ensure system stability and application compatibility, as different applications might require different versions of system files. 2. Updates and Patches: Windows updates and patches often add new versions of system files to the WinSxS folder. Over time, as you install updates and patches, the folder can grow significantly. 3. Component-Based Servicing: The WinSxS folder is part of Microsoft's component-based servicing (CBS) mechanism, which allows for the management of system components, updates, and configuration changes. It ensures that the operating system can be updated and modified without compromising its stability. 4. Manifests and Metadata: The WinSxS folder also contains manifest files and metadata that describe the relationships between different versions of system files and components. These files facilitate the operation of the Windows Resource Protection (WRP) mechanism, which helps maintain system integrity by protecting critical system files from being modified or corrupted. 5.Disk Cleanup: Windows includes a Disk Cleanup utility that can help manage the size of the WinSxS folder by removing outdated and unnecessary system files and components. However, it's essential to use this tool carefully, as removing the wrong files can potentially destabilize the system. Overall, while the WinSxS folder's size can sometimes seem excessive, its purpose is to ensure system stability, compatibility, and maintainability in the Windows operating system ecosystem. "StartComponentCleanup" is a command-line option for the Windows Component Store Cleanup task, which is a feature introduced in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012. It's designed to help manage the size of the WinSxS folder, which can become quite large over time due to the accumulation of system files and updates. The WinSxS folder, as explained earlier, contains various versions of system files and components to ensure system stability and application compatibility. However, this can lead to the consumption of a significant amount of disk space, especially on systems that have been in use for a long time. StartComponentCleanup The "StartComponentCleanup" command initiates the Component Store Cleanup task, which performs the following actions: 1. Component Store Cleanup: The task analyzes the WinSxS folder and removes files that are no longer needed for system operation or servicing. It identifies files that are no longer referenced by the system or applications and safely deletes them. 2. Windows Update Cleanup: This option, when enabled, also includes cleanup of outdated Windows Update files that are no longer necessary for the system. 3. Disk Space Reclamation: By removing unnecessary files, the Component Store Cleanup task helps reclaim disk space, potentially freeing up several gigabytes of storage space on the system drive. It's important to note that while running the Component Store Cleanup task can help free up disk space, it should be done with caution. Deleting files from the WinSxS folder may impact the system's ability to repair itself or uninstall updates in the future. Therefore, it's generally recommended to use tools like "StartComponentCleanup" judiciously and to ensure that the system is in a stable state before initiating cleanup operations.
description:
INHOUDSOPGAVE

  • C drive Full - General
    • Clean Up WINsXs folder
  • See also info found on Chat GPT
    • WinSxS" folder
    • StartComponentCleanup 

C drive Full - General

It can happen in case of a small C-Drive on your server that this drive is running out of disk space because there are Windows update downloaded and pending for a server reboot to be installed.

The cause of this is mostly the contents of the folder Windows\WinSxS

In the folder Windows\WinSxS the files for the updates are stored.

After the installation of the Updates is finished you will see that Windows has cleaned up a big part of this folder.


Clean Up WINsXs folder

It is recommended to start the task StartComponentCleanUp after the reboot and Updates

You can find this task in Windows Scheduled tasks:


R-mouse click and choose run.

Attention: This can take a long time !

You can not start this task when there are till Updates pending for installation which require a reboot


See also info found on Chat GPT

WinSxS" folder

The "WinSxS" folder, which stands for "Windows Side by Side," is a critical component of the Windows operating system architecture, particularly in versions such as Windows Vista, Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 10. The folder contains what are called "side-by-side" assemblies.

Here are a few reasons why the WinSxS folder can become large:

  1. 1. Component Store: WinSxS is essentially a component store that holds various versions of system files and system file dependencies. This redundancy is necessary to ensure system stability and application compatibility, as different applications might require different versions of system files.


  3. 2. Updates and Patches: Windows updates and patches often add new versions of system files to the WinSxS folder. Over time, as you install updates and patches, the folder can grow significantly.


  5. 3. Component-Based Servicing: The WinSxS folder is part of Microsoft's component-based servicing (CBS) mechanism, which allows for the management of system components, updates, and configuration changes. It ensures that the operating system can be updated and modified without compromising its stability.


  7. 4. Manifests and Metadata: The WinSxS folder also contains manifest files and metadata that describe the relationships between different versions of system files and components. These files facilitate the operation of the Windows Resource Protection (WRP) mechanism, which helps maintain system integrity by protecting critical system files from being modified or corrupted.


  9. 5.Disk Cleanup: Windows includes a Disk Cleanup utility that can help manage the size of the WinSxS folder by removing outdated and unnecessary system files and components. However, it's essential to use this tool carefully, as removing the wrong files can potentially destabilize the system.

Overall, while the WinSxS folder's size can sometimes seem excessive, its purpose is to ensure system stability, compatibility, and maintainability in the Windows operating system ecosystem.

"StartComponentCleanup" is a command-line option for the Windows Component Store Cleanup task, which is a feature introduced in Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012. It's designed to help manage the size of the WinSxS folder, which can become quite large over time due to the accumulation of system files and updates.

The WinSxS folder, as explained earlier, contains various versions of system files and components to ensure system stability and application compatibility. However, this can lead to the consumption of a significant amount of disk space, especially on systems that have been in use for a long time.

StartComponentCleanup 

The "StartComponentCleanup" command initiates the Component Store Cleanup task, which performs the following actions:

  1. 1. Component Store Cleanup: The task analyzes the WinSxS folder and removes files that are no longer needed for system operation or servicing. It identifies files that are no longer referenced by the system or applications and safely deletes them.

  2. 2. Windows Update Cleanup: This option, when enabled, also includes cleanup of outdated Windows Update files that are no longer necessary for the system.

  3. 3. Disk Space Reclamation: By removing unnecessary files, the Component Store Cleanup task helps reclaim disk space, potentially freeing up several gigabytes of storage space on the system drive.

It's important to note that while running the Component Store Cleanup task can help free up disk space, it should be done with caution. Deleting files from the WinSxS folder may impact the system's ability to repair itself or uninstall updates in the future. Therefore, it's generally recommended to use tools like "StartComponentCleanup" judiciously and to ensure that the system is in a stable state before initiating cleanup operations.

title: Headset - Jabra Direct - Reset base
text: If you use a Jabra Direct headset and experience problems with it not ringing (you can only hear it ring when you're wearing the headset), you need to reset the base. If the screen on the base looks like this, it is set up wrong. (1) This symbol is not supposed to be there. Reset the base by pressing the menu button (2) for 3 seconds. Choose Base by pressing + and accepting it by pressing the tick Scroll down to Reset Configuration and choose yes with - The base reboots. Choose your prefered language Choose Yes for Start setup Choose no for Set up desk phone with - Choose no for Set up mobile device with - It will update and you're done. Your headset should now function properly.
description:
If you use a Jabra Direct headset and experience problems with it not ringing (you can only hear it ring when you're wearing the headset), you need to reset the base.


If the screen on the base looks like this, it is set up wrong. 


(1) This symbol is not supposed to be there.


Reset the base by pressing the menu button (2) for 3 seconds.


Choose Base by pressing + and accepting it by pressing the tick


Scroll down to Reset Configuration and choose yes with -


The base reboots.


Choose your prefered language


Choose Yes for Start setup


Choose no for Set up desk phone with -


Choose no for Set up mobile device with -


It will update and you're done. Your headset should now function properly.

title: Customer card scan running slowly
text: When you scan a member card it runs: MC_GetTillCustomer If you get a timeout: Re-index the database. Add this missing index: ------------------- USE [MStore] GO SET ANSI_PADDING ON GO CREATE NONCLUSTERED INDEX [TillOptimisationFix-20241016] ON [dbo].[Customer] ( [cusOLDMembNo] ASC )WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, SORT_IN_TEMPDB = OFF, DROP_EXISTING = OFF, ONLINE = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON, FILLFACTOR = 90) ON [PRIMARY] GO ------------------- Has been added to the latest update scripts (17 Oct 24)
description:
When you scan a member card it runs: 


MC_GetTillCustomer


If you get a timeout:



Re-index the database. 


Add this missing index:


-------------------


USE [MStore]
GO
 
SET ANSI_PADDING ON
GO

CREATE NONCLUSTERED INDEX [TillOptimisationFix-20241016] ON [dbo].[Customer]
(
 [cusOLDMembNo] ASC
)WITH (PAD_INDEX = OFF, STATISTICS_NORECOMPUTE = OFF, SORT_IN_TEMPDB = OFF, DROP_EXISTING = OFF, ONLINE = OFF, ALLOW_ROW_LOCKS = ON, ALLOW_PAGE_LOCKS = ON, FILLFACTOR = 90) ON [PRIMARY]
GO 


-------------------


Has been added to the latest update scripts (17 Oct 24)

title: Recovering missing Cash Statement
text: - In Imagine, go to Platform Admin > Tenants - Select the Tenant of your choice - Go to the tab "Connectors" and select the connector - Click on "Choose Command" and select the command ResendCashStatement - Select the date which you are missing for the customer
description:
- In Imagine, go to Platform Admin > Tenants

- Select the Tenant of your choice

- Go to the tab "Connectors" and select the connector

- Click on "Choose Command" and select the command ResendCashStatement

- Select the date which you are missing for the customer

title: Prevent server from logging off/Disconnecting RDP
text: Method 1: Modify Local Group Policy Open Local Group Policy Editor: Press Win + R, type gpedit.msc, and hit Enter. Navigate to Remote Desktop Session Host Settings: Go to: Computer Configuration  Administrative Templates  Windows Components  Remote Desktop Services  Remote Desktop Session Host  Session Time Limits Adjust Session Settings: Double-click the following policies and configure them as needed: Set time limit for disconnected sessions: Set it to "Disabled" or define a sufficiently long time (e.g., 24 hours). End session when time limits are reached: Set to "Disabled". Click Apply and OK after making changes. Restart the Server: Restart the server or run gpupdate /force to apply the changes immediately.
description:
Method 1: Modify Local Group Policy

  1. Open Local Group Policy Editor:
    • Press Win + R, type gpedit.msc, and hit Enter.
  2. Navigate to Remote Desktop Session Host Settings:
    • Go to:
      Computer Configuration Administrative Templates Windows Components Remote Desktop Services Remote Desktop Session Host Session Time Limits
  3. Adjust Session Settings:
    • Double-click the following policies and configure them as needed:
      • Set time limit for disconnected sessions: Set it to "Disabled" or define a sufficiently long time (e.g., 24 hours).
      • End session when time limits are reached: Set to "Disabled".
    • Click Apply and OK after making changes.
  4. Restart the Server:
    • Restart the server or run gpupdate /force to apply the changes immediately.

title: Cleaing WinSXS Folder with CMD
text: Run the following command: Note: Using /resetbase makes it impossible to uninstall previous updates, so use it carefully. dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup /resetbase
description:
1. Run the following command:
    • Note: Using /resetbase makes it impossible to uninstall previous updates, so use it carefully.
dism.exe /online /cleanup-image /startcomponentcleanup /resetbase

title: Cleaning IE5 contents on server
text: Method 1: Using Disk Cleanup Tool Open Disk Cleanup: Press Win + R, type cleanmgr, and press Enter. Select the Drive: Choose the system drive (usually C:) and click OK. Check "Temporary Internet Files": In the Disk Cleanup dialog, look for Temporary Internet Files and check the box. Optionally, select other items you want to clean. Clean Up: Click OK and confirm the cleanup process. Method 2: Manually Deleting Content in Content.IE5 Show Hidden Files: Open File Explorer, go to the View tab (or Options  View in older versions). Enable Show hidden files, folders, and drives. Uncheck Hide protected operating system files (Recommended) and confirm. Navigate to the Folder: The Content.IE5 folder is located at: Replace with your actual username. C:\Users\\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\Content.IE5 Delete the Contents: Open the Content.IE5 folder. Select and delete its contents (not the folder itself). Restore Folder View Settings: After cleaning, re-enable Hide protected operating system files to avoid accidental changes to critical files.
description:
Method 1: Using Disk Cleanup Tool

  1. Open Disk Cleanup:
    • Press Win + R, type cleanmgr, and press Enter.
  2. Select the Drive:
    • Choose the system drive (usually C:) and click OK.
  3. Check "Temporary Internet Files":
    • In the Disk Cleanup dialog, look for Temporary Internet Files and check the box.
    • Optionally, select other items you want to clean.
  4. Clean Up:
    • Click OK and confirm the cleanup process.

Method 2: Manually Deleting Content in Content.IE5

  1. Show Hidden Files:
    • Open File Explorer, go to the View tab (or Options View in older versions).
    • Enable Show hidden files, folders, and drives.
    • Uncheck Hide protected operating system files (Recommended) and confirm.
  2. Navigate to the Folder:
    • The Content.IE5 folder is located at:
    • Replace <YourUsername> with your actual username.
C:\Users\<YourUsername>\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\Content.IE5
  1. Delete the Contents:
    • Open the Content.IE5 folder.
    • Select and delete its contents (not the folder itself).
  2. Restore Folder View Settings:
    • After cleaning, re-enable Hide protected operating system files to avoid accidental changes to critical files.
